testcase.brief: Verify read-write user cann’t create/modify/delete root-admin user
testcase.description: Description Verify read-write user cann’t create/modify/delete root-admin user Pre-condition Create a read-write user in AP Enable telnet in AP Test procedure 1. Created read-write user to login AP via console or SSH or telnet 2. Modify root-admin user’s password 3. Create a new root-admin user 4. Delete root-admin user Expect result 1. Login AP successful 2. Could not modify root-admin user’s password, suggest error 3. Could not create root-admin user, suggest error 4. Could not delete root-admin user, suggest error

step.desc: Create a read write user to AP
Use created read write user login AP via console and create root admin user
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via console and change default root admin user's password by CLI
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via console and delete root admin user by CLI
Use created read write user login AP via ssh and create root admin user
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via ssh and change default root admin user's password by CLI
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via ssh and delete root admin user by CLI
Use created read write user login AP via telnet and create root admin user
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via telnet and change default root admin user's password by CLI
step.log-match: -i "ERROR:" -i "login user is not a super user!" -c

step.desc: Read write user login AP via telnet and delete root admin user by CLI
